page.title: 13Ecology:Ornithology
page.content: Beck Mill contains a wide variety of habitat including deciduous woodland, conifer plantation, wet scrubland, pasture and arable fields with a mixture of sandy and clay soils. These habitats attract large numbers of birds. In the spring Swallows, Martins,Geese, Fly-catchers,Blackcaps, Whitethroats and many other species arrive from their winterings. Passage migrants stop on their way back to their nesting sights to restore their energy. These include Ospreys, Golden Plovers and various others.Then there are the residents Bullfinches,Woodcock Wood Peckers, Herons, Greenfinches and Red Polls. We have put up over 20 bird boxes.There are hole nesters boxes for tits, open fronted boxes for fly- catchers, wedge boxes for treecreepers large open fronted boxes for kestrels and chimney boxes for tawney owls.
